explanation:
To decide whether any statements in reply_with_page_not_found are unreachable you must know if called routines or used types/values can fail to return or force control-flow transfers (noreturn/longjmp/exit) or otherwise change the control flow: 

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static: need its declaration/definition and attributes to know whether it can return NULL (the code checks that) and whether it ever does not return (noreturn) or performs a longjmp/exit that would make code after the call unreachable.

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls: reply_with_page_not_found calls the _static variant which dispatches to this helper (per call graph). If that helper is noreturn or causes control transfer, the remainder of the function may be unreachable — so its definition/attributes are required.

- MHD_add_response_header: although its return value is ignored, if this function is annotated noreturn or contains an unconditional control transfer (exit/longjmp), the subsequent calls (MHD_queue_response, MHD_destroy_response, return ret) would be unreachable. Its implementation/attributes must be inspected.

- MHD_queue_response: this is the core call that sets ret and after which the function calls MHD_destroy_response and returns. If MHD_queue_response is noreturn or performs a control transfer (e.g., longjmp, thread exit, process exit), the later lines would be unreachable. Provide its prototype/definition/attributes.

- MHD_destroy_response: called after MHD_queue_response; if this function does not return (noreturn or similar) it would make the final return unreachable. The implementation/attributes are needed.

- enum MHD_Result (and value MHD_NO): the function returns an enum value; the meaning of MHD_NO and other enum values may be relevant to verify whether earlier return (return MHD_NO) is legal and whether any macros/attributes tied to particular enum values affect control flow. At minimum, the enum definition documents return types and any special semantics.

Collecting the declarations/definitions (or at least attributes/annotations and whether they call exit/longjmp) for these symbols is sufficient to determine whether any statements in reply_with_page_not_found are unreachable under the MISRA C rule about unreachable code.
